hotspots.label: Plant Seedling
hotspots.fact: Plants can absorb nutrients and water directly through their roots, which is why this seedling can survive in the bottle.

hotspots.label: Recycled Bottle
hotspots.fact: This plastic bottle is being reused as a planter instead of being thrown away! Recycling and reusing materials helps protect our environment. Creative reuse like this shows how we can solve problems with everyday objects.

hotspots.label: Green Leaves
hotspots.fact: The bright green color of these leaves comes from chlorophyll, a special pigment that helps plants make food from sunlight! This process is called photosynthesis and is how plants get energy to grow.

hotspots.label: Window View
hotspots.fact: Plants need sunlight to grow, which is why this seedling is placed near a sunny window! Sunlight provides the energy plants need for photosynthesis, helping them grow strong and healthy leaves and roots.
